content:
Is there a problem in the natural number game? The description of how simp works is that it should be able to sort out commutatitivity and associativity differences in expressions but it doesn't seem to have done this in this example.

Have I fundamentally misunderstood what simp does or are there some attributes missing somewhere?
image.png
Like it seems fine for e.g. simplifying a +0 or a * 0 or whatever so I assume it's not totally broken

The natural number game is currently undergoing extensive revisions. simp was totally haphazard in NNG3 and the NNG4 online right now is just a partial port of NNG3. All levels are being rewritten so I'm afraid you're just going to have to tolerate this bug for another week or two, before we release the "official" version of NNG4 where all the levels are changed/reordered etc.
Leo Shine has marked this topic as resolved.

In general comm lemmas are not part of the simp set though (they might make it loop!), so looking at your actual question I think that simp is perhaps not the right tactic. The correct thing to do is to add results like mul_right_comm etc, the Knuth-Bendix list of lemmas, and then it should work. But I'd never heard of Knuth-Bendix when I was writing NNG3.
